description: From Ancient Greek φιλέλλην (philéllēn), corresponding to phil- +‎ Hellene.

adjectives.description: philhellene (comparative more philhellene, superlative most philhellene)

entries.meaning: A lover of Greece or Greek culture. [from 19th c.]
(now historical) Specifically, a supporter of Greek independence, especially during the Greek war of independence in 1821-29. [from 19th c.]
examples: Some historians have suggested that modern ‘humanitarian intervention’ began with the philhellenes in Greece in the 1820.
